H0.text: Meter is the unit of measurement that astronomers use when measuring the distance between two stars found in the Milky Way.

H1.text: Lightâ€‘year is the unit of measurement astronomers use when measuring the distance between two stars found in the Milky Way.

H2.text: Kilometers are the unit of measurement astronomers use when measuring the distance between two stars found in the Milky Way.

H3.text: The astronomical unit is the unit of measurement astronomers use when measuring the distance between two stars found in the Milky Way.

A4.text: The light-year is most often used when expressing distances to stars and other distances on a galactic scale, especially in non-specialist contexts and popular science publications.

A5.text: Distances expressed in light-years include those between stars in the same general area, such as those belonging to the same spiral arm or globular cluster.
